result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable to the Clerk of Court within 60 days.  If unable to pay, Defendant may seek a Payment Plan agreement with the Clerk of Court.  However, if the plan falls into default status with missed payments, the debt will be subject to fail-to-pay actions by the clerk including but not limited to civil judgment, tax refund interception, commitment order, and turnover to collection agency.

With huber.  Consecutive to the conditional jail time in 15CF79.
Consecutive to: 15CF79 conditional time
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Michael L. Wilson in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def is before the Court for sentencing on Count 1 in 15CF79 and Count 2 in 15CM187.  DA and Atty. Longacre each argue their positions for sentence. PSI author/DOC Agent Salisbury addresses the Court.  State asks for prison; Defense asks Court to follow PSI recommendation.

Court follows PSI recommendation. 

Sentence:

15CF79 - withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  120 days jail with work release privileges.  Not to possess/consume any alcohol or controlled substances for which def does not have prescription.  Complete psych. assessment and follow through.  Provide DNA sample.  Subject to random u.a.  First 10 months probation - at least one random u.a. per month.  Complete any asst/programming ordered by agent.  Write letter of apology, approved by agent before forwarding to victim.  Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  

15CM187 - Count 2/OWI 2nd - $1429, 10 days jail, 12 mo revocation, 12 mo IID, AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  60 dtp.  Jail is consecutive to the conditional jail time in 15CF79.

Credit for time served:  4 days in the event of revocation in 15CF79.

Defense has requested a stay of the jail.  State objects to a stay beyond June 23rd.  Court orders report between 6-7 a.m. June 23rd - on or before.  

Defendant to submit DNA sample and sign up for probation today.

Felony admonishments provided in 15CF79.

Counts 1 and 3 DRI in 15CM187.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael L. Wilson in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for status:  15CF79, 15CM187, 15TR1613, 15TR1614, and 15TR1643.  DA states that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will be pleading to the burglary count in 15CF79 and to the OWI 2nd count (count 2) in 15CM187; asking for PSI order in 15CF79 with sentencing in both 15CF79 and 15CM187 set for the same date/time.  Def pleads no contest to the two stated charges.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered in 15CF79; due 6/8; PSI writer to attend or be available by phone for sentencing 6/15 at 9.  Sentencing in 15CM187 set for same date/time.  DA states that this will be an argued sentencing; asks Court to block off extra time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 03-30-2016 02:30 pm

Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant and Atty. Longacre were in court prior to this matter being called at 2:35 p.m.; defense counsel had to leave; got next date/time from clerk; that date - 3/30 at 2:30 noted for the record.  All def's matters reset to then at request of DA and Defense.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 02-17-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Michael L. Wilson in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for status - 15CF79, 15CM187, 15TR1614, 15TR1643, and 15TR12613.  DA states that Defense has asked for an offer; parties are working on these matters; counsel ask for further status.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 01-13-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Michael L. Wilson in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  

15CM187/initial appearance (Atty. L represents as SPD in this matter)
15CF79/status (Atty. L represents as SPD in this matter)
15TR1613/status
15TR1614/status
15TR1643/status

15CM187 - Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Atty. L enters NG pleas on his client's behalf.

Atty. L states parties have been discussing possible global resolution; asks for continuation of status to 1/13 at 9.  So ordered.
  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
AMENDED from cash bond
